subject: Re: [junit] bad class file error with KitchenSink app
msgSnippet: ... Check what JDK version you re using. http://www.google.co.uk/search?q=class+file+has+wrong+version+49.0%2C+should+be+48.0 Cheers, James
messageBody:
On 08/11/2007, Will McQueen <willmcqueen@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
> I'd like to use JUnit 4.x with GWT, but I get the error shown below. I
> don't get this error if I use JUnit 3.x. I'm using command-line only,
> and I created the ant build file with GWT's "projectCreator -ant
> KitchenSink". I see other posts regarding JUnit 4.4, so it seems some
> people have gotten this to work. How can I get around this "bad class
> file" issue? For easy reference, here's the relevant ant target that
> fails:
>
> <path id="project.class.path">
> <pathelement path="${java.class.path}/"/>
> <pathelement path="C:/gwt-windows-1.4.60/gwt-user.jar"/>
> <pathelement path="C:/junit-4.0.jar"/>
> <!-- Additional dependencies (such as junit) go here -->
> </path>
>
> <target name="compile" description="Compile src to bin">
> <mkdir dir="bin"/>
> <javac srcdir="src:test" destdir="bin" includes="**" debug="on"
> debuglevel="lines,vars,source" source="1.4" >
> <classpath refid="project.class.path"/>
> </javac>
> </target>
>
> Help is greatly appreciated!
>
> Thanks,
> Will
>
> ==========
> C:\gwt-windows-1.4.60\samples\KitchenSink>ant -f KitchenSink.ant.xml
> Buildfile: KitchenSink.ant.xml
>
> compile:
> [javac] Compiling 12 source files to
> C:\gwt-windows-1.4.60\samples\KitchenSi
> nk\bin
> [javac]
> C:\gwt-windows-1.4.60\samples\KitchenSink\test\com\google\gwt\sample
> \kitchensink\client\KitchenSinkTest.java:8: cannot access
> junit.framework.TestCa
> se
> [javac] bad class file:
> C:\junit-4.0.jar(junit/framework/TestCase.class)
> [javac] class file has wrong version 49.0, should be 48.0
> [javac] Please remove or make sure it appears in the correct
> subdirectory of
> the classpath.
> [javac] public class KitchenSinkTest extends GWTTestCase {
> [javac] ^
> [javac] 1 error
>
> BUILD FAILED
> C:\gwt-windows-1.4.60\samples\KitchenSink\KitchenSink.ant.xml:18:
> Compile failed
> ; see the compiler error output for details.
> ==========
>

Check what JDK version you're using.

http://www.google.co.uk/search?q=class+file+has+wrong+version+49.0%2C+should+be+48.0

Cheers,

James
